_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

Characteristics of a mendicant who is no: Doesn't foster keenness by thinking: ‘If unarisen unskillful qualities arise in me, they’ll lead to harm.’
Doesn't foster keenness by thinking: ‘If I don’t give up arisen unskillful qualities, they’ll lead to harm.’
Doesn't foster keenness by thinking: ‘If I don’t give rise to unarisen skillful qualities, they’ll lead to harm.’
Doesn't foster keenness by thinking: ‘If arisen skillful qualities cease in me, they’ll lead to harm.’
Characteristics of a mendicant who is ke: Fosters keenness by thinking: ‘If unarisen unskillful qualities arise in me, they’ll lead to harm.’
Fosters keenness by thinking: ‘If I don’t give up arisen unskillful qualities, they’ll lead to harm.’
Fosters keenness by thinking: ‘If I don’t give rise to unarisen skillful qualities, they’ll lead to harm.’
Fosters keenness by thinking: ‘If arisen skillful qualities cease in me, they’ll lead to harm.’
